1.text: My son, if you would accept my words, and conceal my commandments within you,

2.text: so that your ears may listen to wisdom, then bend your heart in order to know prudence.

3.text: For if you would call upon wisdom and bend your heart to prudence,

4.text: if you will seek her like money, and dig for her as if for treasure,

5.text: then you will understand the fear of the Lord, and you will discover the knowledge of God.

6.text: For the Lord bestows wisdom, and out of his mouth, prudence and knowledge.

7.text: He will preserve the salvation of the righteous, and he will protect those who walk in simplicity:

8.text: serving the paths of justice, and guarding the ways of sanctity.

9.text: Then you shall understand justice and judgment, and equity, and every good path.

10.text: If wisdom is to enter into your heart, and if knowledge is to become pleasing to your soul,

11.text: then counsel must guard you, and prudence must serve you,

12.text: so that you may be rescued from the evil way, and from the man who speaks perversities,

13.text: from those who leave the straight path to walk in dark ways,

14.text: who rejoice when they have done evil, and who exult in the most wicked things.

15.text: Their ways are perverse, and their steps are infamous.

16.text: So may you be rescued from the foreign woman, and from the outsider, who softens her speech,

17.text: and who leaves behind the Guide of her youth,

18.text: and who has forgotten the covenant of her God. For her household inclines toward death, and her paths toward Hell.

19.text: All those who enter to her will not return again, nor will they take hold of the paths of life.

20.text: So may you walk in the good way, and keep to the difficult paths of the just.

21.text: For those who are upright shall live upon the earth, and the simple shall continue upon it.

22.text: Yet truly, the impious shall perish from the earth, and those who act unjustly shall be taken away from it.
